*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Elias R. Wightman, November 4, 1829. Advice concerning manufacture of salt.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**p*Mr. E R Weightman*/p**/p* *p*Dr Sir*/p*,
*p*In regard to the *location_mentioned*salt lots*/location_mentioned*. I think that if you could lease to *person_mentioned*Burnham*/person_mentioned*, and give him the previlege for a certain number of years- say three or four or five, on condition that he kept the *location_mentioned*works */location_mentioned*agoing, and at the end of the lease the *location_mentioned*lots */location_mentioned*to be given up with such improvements and kettles etc as may then be on the place, without binding him to any specific kind or value of improvements—The main object is to start the thing now for the benifit of the *location_mentioned*place*/location_mentioned*, the *location_mentioned*lots */location_mentioned*hereafter will be valuable, and it is better to give the use of the *location_mentioned*lots */location_mentioned*for nothing for a certain number of years than to sell- also it is better to give the previlege to *person_mentioned*Burnham */person_mentioned*to keep all his kettles when his time is out-— This is my opinion-tho you must do as you think best or proper and either sell or lease as may be thought by you best—*/p*
*p*I am ready at any time to give you a full power of attorney as *person_mentioned*agent of the proprietors*/person_mentioned*, I proposed to *person_mentioned*League */person_mentioned*on my return *date_mentioned n="Summer - 1829">last summer*/date_mentioned* to go immediately down and he promised to do so, but has been in bad health— As soon as it is possible for me to do so I will go down there and make a final arrangement and in the meantime I will agree to any dispositions of *location_mentioned*lots */location_mentioned*to actual *person_mentioned*settlers */person_mentioned*who im- prove them, that you may make— The time has not quite arrived to push that *location_mentioned*place*/location_mentioned*—there must be some more *location_mentioned*settlements */location_mentioned*and some more wealth round*location_mentioned* Bay Prairie*/location_mentioned* and *location_mentioned*on the river */location_mentioned*and it will not advance the place much to sell lots at this time, for they will get into the hands of *person_mentioned*persons */person_mentioned*who will keep them merely for speculation and they had better remain in the hands of the *person_mentioned*proprietors*/person_mentioned* than in any others. I am in favor of letting *location_mentioned*lots */location_mentioned*go to actual *person_mentioned*settlers*/person_mentioned* who will improve them but think that the *location_mentioned*lots */location_mentioned*will be better in the hands of the *person_mentioned*proprietors */person_mentioned*than in those of such persons as would be likely to buy at a *location_mentioned*public sale */location_mentioned*at this time, tho I am willing to do on my part whatever may be thought best—*/p*
*p*I have been greatly disappointed by the long delay of the *person_mentioned*Commissioner*/person_mentioned*— I do not expect him now for *date_mentioned n="11-25-1829">three weeks*/date_mentioned*—and I can do nothing until] he arrives.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="11-04-1829">Nov 4. 1829*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Mr. Elias E. Weightman*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Matagorda*/location_mentioned* *person_mentioned*Cap. Burnham*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
